IRS990.ActivityOrMissionDesc: TO PROTECT FARM ANIMALS FROM CRUELTY, INSPIRE CHANGE IN THE WAY SOCIETY VIEWS AND TREATS FARM ANIMALS, AND PROMOTE COMPASSIONATE VEGAN LIVING.
IRS990.MissionDesc: TO PROTECT FARM ANIMALS FROM CRUELTY, INSPIRE CHANGE IN THE WAY SOCIETY VIEWS AND TREATS FARM ANIMALS, AND PROMOTE COMPASSIONATE VEGAN LIVING.
IRS990.Desc: RESCUE, SHELTER, AND ADOPTION: PROVIDING RESCUE, REHABILITATION, AND CARE FOR ABUSED AND NEGLECTED FARM ANIMALS, AS WELL AS OFFERING SERVICES INVOLVING ADOPTIONS, ANIMAL PLACEMENT ASSISTANCE, AND ANIMAL CARE INFORMATION.

ProgSrvcAccomActy2Grp.Desc: EDUCATION AND OUTREACH: PROVIDING PROGRAMS AND DISSEMINATING LITERATURE AND INFORMATION TO EDUCATE THE PUBLIC ABOUT FARM ANIMAL ISSUES. PROGRAMS INCLUDE FARM TOURS, EDUCATION CENTERS, CONFERENCES, SPEAKING EVENTS, VOLUNTEER AND INTERNSHIP PROGRAMS FOR HANDS-ON EXPERIENCE, AND COMMUNITY OUTREACH EVENTS.

ProgSrvcAccomActy3Grp.Desc: ADVOCACY AND ACTION: WORKING TO PASS HUMANE LEGISLATION AND IMPLEMENT STRONGER REGULATORY ENFORCEMENT OF EXISTING LAWS, ENGAGING IN LITIGATION ON BEHALF OF FARM ANIMALS, AND ENCOURAGING CONSUMERS, LAWMAKERS, AND BUSINESSES TO CONSIDER FARM ANIMAL ISSUES IN THEIR DECISION-MAKING PROCESSES.

SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: TO PROVIDE ADDITIONAL SUPPORT TO FURTHER THE ORGANIZATION'S TAX-EXEMPT PURPOSE.

THE ORGANIZATION ACCOUNTS FOR ANY UNCERTAINTIES IN INCOME TAXES RECOGNIZED IN ACCORDANCE WITH FASB ACCOUNTING STANDARDS CODIFICATION 740-10 "INCOME TAXES." ASC 740-10 PRESCRIBES THAT THE ORGANIZATION RECOGNIZE THE IMPACT OF TAX POSIIONS THAT ARE MORE LIKELY THAN NOT (>50%) TO BE SUSTAINED UPON EXAMINATION BASED ON THE TECHNICAL MERITS OF THE POSITION. IN ACCORDANCE WITH ASC 740-10, THE ORGANIZATION ADOPTED A POLICY TO RECOGNIZE PENALTIES AND INTEREST RESULTING FROM THOSE UNCERTAINTIES IN TH EPERIOD IN WHICH THEY ARE INCURRED AS OPERATING EXPENSES. THE ORGANIZATION HAS EVALUATED ITS TAX POSITIONS AND THE CERTAINTY AS TO WHETHER THOSE POSITIONS WILL BE SUSTAINED IN THE EVENT OF AN AUDIT BY TAXING AUTHORITIES AT THE FEDERAL AND STATE LEVELS. THE PRIMARY TAX POSITIONS EVALUATED ARE RELATED TO THE ORGANIZATION'S CONTINUED QUALIFICATION AS A TAX-EXEMPT ORGANIZATION AND WHETHER THERE IS UNRELATED BUSINESS INCOME ACTIVITIES CONDUCTED THAT WOULD BE TAXABLE. MANAGEMENT HAS DETERMINED THAT ALL INCOME TAX POSITIONS ARE MORE LIKELY THAN NOT (>50%) OF BEING SUSTAINED UPON POTENTIAL AUDIT OR EXAMINIATION; THEREFORE, NO DISCLOSURES OF UNCERTAIN TAX POSITIONS ARE REQUIRED. THE ORGANIZATION FILES INFORMATION TAX REURNS IN THE U.S. FEDERAL AND VARIOUS STATE JURISDICTIONS. WITH FEW EXCEPTIONS, THE ORGANIZATION IS NO LONGER SUBJECT TO U.S. FEDERAL AND STATE EXAMINIATIONS BY TAX AUTHORITIES FOR YEARS BEFORE 2012 AND 2011, RESPECTIVELY.
IMPAIRMENT LOSS ON PROPERTIES HELD FOR SALE

AccountActivitiesOutsideUSGrp.TypeOfActivitiesConductedTxt: WALKATHONS TOOK PLACE IN TORONTO AND VANCOUVER, CANADA DURING 2015.

RecipientTable.PurposeOfGrantTxt: SUPPORT PRODUCTION OF A MISSION-ALIGNED DOCUMENTARY

SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: THE ORGANIZATION PROVIDED GRANT FUNDS ON A STRICT PROJECT SPECIFIC BASIS. THE ORGANIZATION'S PRESIDENT OF POLICY AND ADVOCACY MAINTAINS REGULAR CONTACT WITH THE GRANTEE REGARDING THE STATUS OF THE PROJECT AND USE OF THE GRANT FUNDS.
A SEVERANCE PAYMENT WAS MADE TO A SENIOR STAFF MEMBER DURING THE YEAR AS PART OF A SEPARATION AGREEMENT.
THE BOARD PROVIDED A DISCRETIONARY BONUS TO THE EXECUTIVE DIRECTOR. THE EXECUTIVE DIRECTOR PROVIDED DISCRETIONARY BONUSES TO SOME MEMBERS OF THE SENIOR STAFF FOR EXCEPTIONAL PERFORMANCE.

THE ORGANIZATION USES MERRILL LYNCH TO PROCESS STOCK DONATIONS AND CARS 4 CAUSES TO PROCESS VEHICLE DONATIONS. THE ORGANIZATION WILL ALSO UTILIZE VARIOUS THIRD PARTIES ON AN AD HOC BASIS TO PROCESS OTHER TYPES OF NON-CASH DONATIONS.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: Form 990, Part VI, Section A, line 8b
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: WE DO NOT TAKE MINUTES AT COMMITTEE MEETINGS. HOWEVER, COMMITTEES REPORT THEIR ACTIVITIES AT BOARD MEETINGS AND ANY ACTIONS RECOMMENDED BY COMMITTEES ARE BROUGHT TO THE FULL BOARD FOR A VOTE.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: Form 990, Part VI, Section B, line 11
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: COPIES OF FORM 990 ARE DISTRIBUTED TO THE FULL BOARD FOR REVIEW PRIOR TO FILING.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: Form 990, Part VI, Section B, line 12c
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: THE EXECUTIVE DIRECTOR, AS WELL AS EACH DEPARTMENT HEAD AND EACH DIRECTOR ON THE BOARD OF DIRECTORS, SHALL ANNUALLY SIGN A STATEMENT AFFIRMING THAT SUCH COVERED PERSON: (I) HAS RECEIVED A COPY OF THE CONFLICT OF INTEREST POLICY, (II) HAS READ AND UNDERSTOOD SUCH POLICY AND (III) HAS AGREED TO COMPLY WITH THE RULES AND PROCEDURES OF THE POLICY. EACH EMPLOYEE, AT THE START OF EMPLOYMENT, SHALL SIGN A STATEMENT AFFIRMING THAT SUCH COVERED PERSON: (I) HAS RECEIVED A COPY OF THE CONFLICT OF INTEREST POLICY, (II) HAS READ AND UNDERSTOOD SUCH POLICY AND (III) HAS AGREED TO COMPLY WITH THE RULES AND PROCEDURES OF THE POLICY.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: Form 990, Part VI, Section B, line 15a
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: THE EXECUTIVE DIRECTOR TOTAL COMPENSATION PACKAGE INCLUDING SALARY, INCENTIVE COMPENSATION, AND ALL BENEFITS, INCLUDING ANY FRINGE BENEFITS, SHALL BE SET UPON THE EXECUTIVE DIRECTOR INITIAL HIRE AND DETERMINED ANNUALLY THEREAFTER. IN SETTING THE EXECUTIVE DIRECTOR COMPENSATION, THE BOARD WILL REQUIRE THAT THE EXECUTIVE COMMITTEE OF THE BOARD TAKE THE FOLLOWING STEPS: 1. THE COMMITTEE WILL OBTAIN RESEARCH AND INFORMATION TO MAKE A RECOMMENDATION TO THE FULL BOARD FOR THE TOTAL COMPENSATION PACKAGE TO BE MADE TO THE EXECUTIVE DIRECTOR. THE COMMITTEE SHOULD CONSIDER THE FOLLOWING INFORMATION IN PREPARING ITS RECOMMENDATION TO THE FULL BOARD: A. ANY RELEVANT COMPENSATION STUDIES CONDUCTED BY INDEPENDENT SOURCES, PARTICULARLY STUDIES REGARDING NON-PROFIT ORGANIZATION EXECUTIVE COMPENSATION PROGRAMS. IF NO STUDIES ARE AVAILABLE, THE COMMITTEE MAY, IN ITS SOLE DISCRETION, COMMISSION SUCH A STUDY SHOULD THE COMMITTEE DETERMINE THAT SUCH A STUDY WOULD BE USEFUL TO THE COMMITTEE. B. INFORMATION CONCERNING EXECUTIVE COMPENSATION OF OTHER NON-PROFIT ORGANIZATIONS THAT MAY BE OBTAINED FROM THE IRS FORM 990 FILINGS OF ORGANIATIONS (OR OTHER SOURCES) OF EITHER (I) SIMILAR ASSET AND/OR ANNUAL REVENUE SIZE TO THE CORPORATION, OR (II) SIMILAR MISSION, PROGRAMS OR SERVICES THAT ARE PROVIDED BY THE CORPORATION. THE COMMITTEE SHOULD CONSIDER AT LEAST 10 SUCH OTHER ORGANIZATIONS. C. THE COMMITTEE SHOULD EVALUATE ANY INDIVIDUAL FACTORS THAT IMPACT COMPENSATION REOMMENDATIONS, INCLUDING FOR INSTANCE, THE GEOGRAPHIC LOCATION WHERE THE EXECUTIVE DIRECTOR WILL WORK OR WORKS AND THE EXECUTIVE DIRECTOR TOTAL COMPENSATION PACKAGE HISTORY AND/OR CONCURRENT OFFER. D. FOR ANNUAL REVIEWS OF THE EXECUTIVE DIRECTOR TOTAL COMPENSATION PACKAGE, THE COMMITTEE SHOULD EVALUATE THE EXECUTIVE DIRECTOR ANNUAL PERFORMANCE VIS-A-VIS GOALS SET BY THE BOARD FOR BOTH THE ORGANIZATION AS A WHOLE AND THE INDIVIDUAL GOALS SET FOR THE EXECUTIVE DIRECTOR. E. OTHER FACTORS THAT THE COMMITTEE MAY DEEM TO BE RELEVANT TO ITS RECOMMENDATION, AS LONG AS SUCH FACTORS ARE REASONABLE AND EXPLAINED IN DETAIL TO THE BOARD. 2. UPON REVIEW OF THE ABOVE-NOTED FACTORS, THE COMMITTEE SHALL VOTE ON A PROPOSED TOTAL COMPENSATION PACKAGE AND, ONCE A MAJORITY OF THE COMMITTEE HAS AGREED ON SUCH A PACKAGE, THE CHAIR OF THE COMMITTEE SHALL PREPARE A WRITTEN REPORT TO THE FULL BOARD, WHICH SHALL BE PRESENTED AT THE NEXT BOARD MEETING FOR APPROVAL. IN ADDITION TO EXPLAINING THE BASIS FOR ITS RECOMMENDATION, THE COMMITTEE REPORT SHALL PROVIDE THE FOLLOWING INFORMATION: A. COPIES OF ANY RELEVANT COMPENSATION STUDIES RELIED UPON OR REVIEWED BY THE COMMITTEE. THE REPORT SHOULD IDENTIFY WHY EACH SUCH STUDY WAS REVIEWED AND/OR RELIED UPON. B. COPIES OF THE 990S (OR OTHER RELEVANT DOCUMENTATION) OF THE EXECUTIVE COMPENSATION PACKAGES OFFERED BY COMPARABLE ORGANIZATION IS RELIED UPON OR REVIEWED BY THE COMMITTEE. THE COMMITTEE REPORT SHOULD ALSO IDENTIFY THE NAMES OF THE ORGANIZATIONS WHOSE EXECUTIVE COMPENSATION PACKAGES WERE REVIEWED AND THE REASONS WHY EACH SUCH ORGANIZATION WAS SELECTED AS A COMPARABLE. C. COPIES OF THE PERFORMANCE EVALUATION CONDUCTED BY THE COMMITTEE OF THE EXECUTIVE DIRECTOR PERFORMANCE. THE REPORT SHOULD EXPLAIN THE IMPACT THE EVALUATION HAD ON THE COMPENSATION RECOMMENDATION (POSITIVE OR NEGATIVE), INCLUDING THE PARTICULAR GOAL(S) MET OR NOT MET THAT IMPACTED THE RECOMMENDATION. D. FOR ANY INDIVIDUAL FACTORS EVALUATED (AND OTHER FACTORS AS IDENTIFIED IN SECTION 1.E. ABOVE), THE REPORT MUST INCLUDE A DETAILED DISCUSSION OF WHY AND HOW THE FACTOR WAS EVALUATED, AND PROVIDE ANY DOCUMENTATION RELIED UPON IN CONNECTION WITH THE CONSIDERATION OF SUCH FACTOR. 3. THE BOARD WILL THEN VOTE ON THE PROPOSED RECOMMENDATION ON THE BOARD MEETING FOLLOWING THE COMPLETION OF THE COMMITTEE RECOMMENDATION. ONCE A MAJORITY OF THE BOARD MEMBERS THEN PRESENT AT SUCH MEETING HAS MADE A DECISION CONCERNING THE EXECUTIVE DIRECTOR TOTAL COMPENSATION PACKAGE, THE BOARD MUST DOCUMENT HOW IT REACHED ITS DECISIONS, INCLUDING THE DATA ON WHICH IT RELIED, IN THE MINUTES OF THE MEETING DURING WHICH THE COMPENSATION PACKAGE WAS APPROVED.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: Form 990, Part VI, Section C, line 19
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: THE ORGANIZATION MAKES ITS GOVERNING DOCUMENTS AND CONFLICT OF INTEREST POLICY AVAILABLE TO THE PUBLIC UPON REQUEST. THE FINANCIAL STATEMENTS ARE AVAILABLE ON THE ORGANIZATION'S WEBSITE.
